author: donschoe
content:
Any thoughts on reducing the number of configuration files required to bootstrap a new testnet to `1` for everyone's convenience?

https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/issues/1662

author: djrtwo
content:
Looks good to me.

I could see the argument for defining two files -- one for the core consensus, one for network settings
A bit torn on which I prefer. I like the idea of bootnodes being updated in a separate place from core items such as `SLOTS_PER_EPOCH`, but some of the core consensus params do affect things like ENRs/finding peers (e.g. `GENESIS_FORK_VERSION`)
